svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Mount the output shaft in a vise with the threaded end up and secure on the range mainshaft ( Figure 214). For models so equipped, install the stepped washer on the shaft, large diameter step down.

figure.caption: Figure 213. Mount Output Shaft in Vise

step1.para: Install the splined spacer on the output shaft ( left, Figure 215). For models equipped with stepped washer on shaft, install the spacer with the large diameter splines down ( right, Figure 215).

figure.caption: Figure 214. Install Splined Spacer on Output Shaft and Install Spacer With Large Diameter Splines Down

para.emph: IMPORTANT: Mark any two adjacent teeth on deep reduction gear and repeat the procedure for the two adjacent teeth directly opposite the first set marked ( Figure 216). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended.

figure.caption: Figure 215. Mark Teeth on Deep Reduction Gear

step1.para: If previously removed, install the snap ring in the deep reduction gear of models so equipped ( inset, Figure 217). Install the gear on the output shaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the splines of the spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 216. Install Snap Ring in Deep Reduction Gear and Install Gear on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the washer on the shaft against the deep reduction gear, small diameter step down ( left, Figure 218: 11608LL Models); or side with the large groove up ( right, Figure 218: 14608LL Models).

figure.caption: Figure 217. Install Washer on Shaft, Small Diameter Step Down or Side With Large Groove Up

note.para: For models not equipped with the oil retention ring in the auxiliary housing, proceed to Step 8.

step1.para: 14608LL Models only - Place the oil retention ring in the housing bore, cupped side up ( left, Figure 219). Use a soft bar and two rear bearing outer spacers stacked on top of each other to move the oil retention ring 2 inches deep into the bore ( right, Figure 219). The ring will be at the proper depth when the top of the second spacer is flush with the housing bore. Remove the spacers when installation is completed.

figure.caption: Figure 218. Place Oil Retention Ring in Housing Bore, and Move Oil Retention Ring into Bore

step1.para: Place two mainshaft spacers or flat steel stock of equivalent thickness (.190 inch) on rear face of the deep reduction gear 180 degrees from each other ( left, Figure 220). Install the auxiliary housing over the end of the output shaft assembly, allowing the housing to rest on the spacers ( right, Figure 220).

figure.caption: Figure 219. Place Mainshaft Spacers on Rear Face of Deep Reduction Gear, and Install Auxiliary Housing Over End of Output Shaft Assembly

step1.para: Heat the front bearing cone and install on output shaft against oil retention ring, bearing taper up ( left, Figure 221). For models not equipped with the oil retention ring in the auxiliary housing, install the heated bearing cone on the shaft against the washer, taper up ( right, Figure 221).

figure.caption: Figure 220. Install Front Bearing Cone on Output Shaft Against Oil Retention Ring or Against Washer

note.para: Do not heat bearing above 275 degrees F (136 degrees C). If possible, use heat lamps as source.

step1.para: Install the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft against the front bearing cone ( Figure 222).

figure.caption: Figure 221. Install Bearing Inner Spacer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Place the front bearing cup in housing bore, taper to the inside, and use a soft bar to start cup into the bore ( Figure 223).

figure.caption: Figure 222. Place Front Bearing Cup in Housing Bore and Start Cup in Bore

step1.para: Stack the bearing outer spacer and rear bearing cup on the top of the front bearing cup in proper sequence ( Figure 224). Use a soft bar or a flanged driver to move all three parts evenly into the housing bore until the lip of the rear bearing cup seats on the housing.

figure.caption: Figure 223. Stack Bearing Outer Spacer and Rear Bearing Cup on Top of Front Bearing Cup, and Move All Three Parts Evenly into Housing Bore

step1.para: If not previously done, install the auxiliary housing over the end of the output shaft assembly ( Figure 225). Heat the rear bearing cone and install on shaft, taper down and inside bearing cup.

figure.caption: Figure 224. Install Auxiliary Housing Over End of Output Shaft Assembly, and Install Rear Bearing Cone

note.para: Do not heat bearing above 275 degrees F (136 degrees C).

step1.para: For 14608LL Model, install the speedometer drive gear or replacement spacer on the output shaft and retain with snap ring installed in the groove of the shaft ( left, Figure 226). Remove the blocking (two shaft spacers or flat steel stock) from between the deep reduction gear and auxiliary housing ( right, Figure 226).

figure.caption: Figure 225. Install Speedometer Drive Gear or Replacement Spacer, and Remove Blocking From Between Deep Reduction Gear and Auxiliary Housing

step1.para: Mount assembly upright in a vise and secure ( Figure 227). Install the deep reduction sliding clutch on the output shaft, internal splines toward the gear and engaged with the splines of the shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 226. Install Deep Reduction Sliding Clutch on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove of the range mainshaft ( Figure 228).

figure.caption: Figure 227. Install Snap Ring in Groove of Range Mainshaft

step1.para: If previously removed, install the oil seal in the rear bearing cover ( inset, Figure 229). Seal should be installed so the spring is to the front of the cover.

figure.caption: Figure 228. Install Oil Seal in Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Position gasket on the cover mounting surface and install the rear bearing cover on the auxiliary housing ( Figure 230). Use the nylon collar and brass washer with the bolt at the chamfered hole which intersects speedometer bore ( inset, Figure 230). Tighten bolts to secure cover to housing.

figure.caption: Figure 229. Install Rear Bearing Cover on Auxiliary Housing, and Use Nylon Collar and Brass Washer

note.para: Because the collar becomes distorted when compressed, DO NOT REUSE OLD NYLON COLLAR.
